title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder dominate as issues plague Wolves
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: OKC rolls to 2-0 lead behind new MVP SGA's 38
content: After receiving his MVP trophy, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 38 points, and the Thunder dominated the Wolves again in a 118-103 win to take a 2-0 series lead.

title: Panthers rout Canes in ECF as Bennett scores 2
content: Sam Bennett scored two goals, and the Panthers beat the Hurricanes 5-0 to take a 2-0 lead in the Eastern Conference final.

title: Fever win in Clark's first 3-less game since '22
content: The Fever beat the Dream on Thursday night despite Caitlin Clark not making a 3 for just the second time in her career, college and pro.

title: Malone clears air: Jokic, not SGA, my MVP choice
content: Former Nuggets coach Michael Malone, who drew the ire of Denver fans when he said Thunder star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander "showed why he's the MVP" earlier this week, said he would have picked Nikola Jokic if he had a vote this season.

title: CFP approves new seeding model next season
content: The College Football Playoff is moving to a straight seeding model, giving the top four teams by seed a first-round bye, the CFP committee announced Thursday.

title: Pirates' Cherington shuts down Skenes trade talk
content: Pirates general manager Ben Cherington said on Thursday that the possibility of trading ace Paul Skenes is "not part of the conversation at all."

title: Rockies off to worst 50-game start since 1895
content: The Rockies were swept in a four-game series by the Phillies to fall to 8-42 this season -- the worst 50-game start in MLB since the 1895 Louisville Colonels (7-43).

title: Ex-Brewer Ruf sues Reds for career-ending injury
content: Former Brewers player Darin Ruf is suing the Reds for damages after he suffered a career-ending injury while playing at Cincinnati's Great American Ball Park two years ago.

title: Panthers dominate in Game 2: Grades for both teams, players to watch for Game 3
content: Can the Hurricanes find a way back into the series as it moves back to Florida? Here's what you need to know.

title: Summing up the offseason for every AFC team: Barnwell's 16 superlatives
content: The Bengals have an unhappy star. The Patriots have turned over their roster. And the Raiders are in line to take a huge step forward.

title: Which rookies will make biggest impact? Projecting first-year leaders in 10 stat areas
content: We predicted the NFL's top rookies in 10 different stats for 2025. Who will dominate box scores this fall?

title: MLB Power Rankings: A brand-new team debuts at No. 1
content: Detroit continues its meteoric rise up our list ... all the way to the top spot in Week 8, bypassing two dominant NL teams.

title: Inside the world of NBA 'ball boys,' the league's unsung heroes
content: Ball boys are everywhere on the court but are rarely seen or acknowledged. And yet, the NBA couldn't function without them.

title: The 12 most impactful NBA draft withdrawal decisions for college basketball
content: Milos Uzan, Alex Condon and other college hoops stars whose NBA draft decisions could materially shape 2025-26.

title: Are the NBA playoffs too physical? Have the refs actually lost control? Here's what the data says
content: The discourse -- and discord -- surrounding playoff officiating isn't new. But this year, players and coaches have wondered if the league has lost control. The NBA says its ref data is in line with past years. Who's right?

title: What this epic Knicks collapse means for the series -- and for New York's title chances
content: As the Pacers rallied in Game 1, the Knicks faced a burden few franchises carry: 50 years of history.

title: Gold Cup absences are a worst-case scenario for USMNT's World Cup hopes
content: The USMNT has precious little time to prep for next year's World Cup. A weakened Gold Cup roster won't help.

title: Olympic-style event in 2026 to feature PED use
content: A new company hoping to infuse PEDs into Olympic-style sports says it will hold its first formal competition next May.

title: Stop worrying and celebrate the tush push -- all the reasons it deserved to live
content: Some believe the play is unstoppable, and now it has proved unkillable -- even for the NFL and its owners.

title: LME's Premier League 2024-25 awards: From MVP to best signing, best goal, more
content: As the 2024-25 Premier League season concludes Sunday, it's time for LME's annual awards. Who earned the highest praise this season?

title: The secret routines fueling NBA players' grip on the game
content: Whether it's hand cream or powder, the on-court routines of NBA players have become a leaguewide obsession.

title: Penske cheating scandal: IndyCar's pre-500 black eye explained
content: For the second time in a year, IndyCar's biggest team (whose owner also owns the series) got caught cheating.

title: Can F1's rule change add action to the spectacle of Monaco?
content: The quirks that make Monaco unique also make it terrible for F1 racing. Will a new rule change fix that?

title: Poch defends Pulisic's USMNT Gold Cup absence
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino defended the decision not to select Christian Pulisic for this summer's Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Modrić to leave Real Madrid after Club World Cup
content: Real Madrid legend Luka Modrić has announced he will leave the club after the end of this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Fore-warned: Poch tells USMNT to forget golf clubs
content: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino set some expectations ahead of the team's return to action at this summer's Concacaf Gold Cup after a disastrous fourth-place finish at the Nations League in March.

title: Conte 'regrets' Napoli absence for Serie A finale
content: Napoli manager Antonio Conte called for calm heads when his team bid to clinch the Serie A title on Friday, underlining his deep sense of responsibility to the city while expressing regret to be watching from the stands due to suspension.

title: Messi: Favorite goal was vs. Man Utd in UCL final
content: Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi named the header he scored against Manchester United in the 2009 Champions League final while representing Barcelona as the favorite goal of his storied career.

title: Deco: Barça like Rashford; PSG watching Yamal
content: Paris Saint-Germain have "always" been interested in signing Lamine Yamal, Barcelona's sporting director Deco said, adding that ahead of the summer window, the club are monitoring Liverpool's Luis Díaz and Manchester United's Marcus Rashford.

title: United miss out as transfer guru signs PSG deal
content: PSG transfer guru Luis Campos has ended speculation over a move to Manchester United by signing a five-year contract with the French club's owners, Qatar Sports Investments (QSI), to continue his role with the Champions League finalists.

title: Fernandes, Garnacho cast doubt over Utd futures
content: Bruno Fernandes and Alejandro Garnacho have cast doubt on their Manchester United futures following the Europa League defeat to Tottenham Hotspur.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: Academic armageddon: Trump hits Harvard with visa ban - what it means for foreign students
content: The Trump administration has revoked Harvard University's ability to enroll international students, jeopardizing the status of nearly 6,800 foreign students. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem cited concerns about antisemitism, pro-Hamas sympathies, and discriminatory diversity policies as the reasons for the decision.

title: Bangladesh interim chief Muhammad Yunus on his way out? What we know
content: Professor Muhammad Yunus, head of Bangladesh's interim government, is considering resigning due to a lack of cooperation from political parties. He feels unable to work effectively without a common ground among them.  "I won't be able to work unless the political parties can reach a common ground," Yunus, chief adviser of the interim government of Bangladesh, reportedly said.​​

title: 'Wanted revenge for Babri Masjid’: Two held for sharing India’s intel with Pak
content: The Uttar Pradesh ATS arrested Tufail Alam, a Varanasi resident, for allegedly collaborating with a Pakistan-sponsored network. He is accused of espionage and attempting to destabilize India. Tufail shared sensitive information and provocative content with Pakistani contacts, including details of vital locations and messages promoting extremist ideologies. An FIR has been registered, and he will face legal action.

title: IPL 2025: Lack of 'home' work cost Delhi Capitals this season
content: Delhi Capitals' IPL campaign faltered after a promising start, winning only one home game at Kotla. Lack of homework on the home ground and inadequate pre-season training at the venue proved costly. Management's unclear strategies regarding batting order and bowler utilization, including Kuldeep Yadav's sporadic usage, further contributed to their struggles.

title: Accent that betrayed: How Afghan man living as ‘Rehan from Patna’ was caught
content: An Afghan national, Jandullah Dad Mohammad, was apprehended at Lucknow airport for possessing forged Indian documents. He attempted to board a flight to Sharjah using the alias Rehan of Patna. Immigration officials grew suspicious due to his accent and inability to answer basic questions about Patna.

title: Everything changed for Elon when Trump denied Tesla CEO access to ..., says MAGA man Steve Bannon
content: Following a New York Times report in March 2025 about a potential Pentagon briefing on U.S.-China conflict, Donald Trump denied Elon Musk's involvement, leading Musk to distance himself from the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Musk shifted his focus back to Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter, reducing his political donations.

title: What's the gold rate outlook for today, should you buy or sell?
content: Gold prices are poised for a weekly gain but face a critical juncture. Technical analysis suggests potential downside moves, with exhaustion near ₹96000. Intraday traders have selling opportunities near ₹95800 or on a breakdown below ₹95250, targeting lower support levels. A failure to reclaim ₹96000 could trigger a deeper correction.

title: Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul's intense post-match chat - Watch
content: Mumbai Indians secured their IPL playoff spot with a dominant 59-run victory over Delhi Capitals, eliminating DC from the competition. Suryakumar Yadav's explosive 73 propelled MI to 180/5, while Delhi collapsed to 121 all out. A post-match interaction between Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul went viral. KL Rahul has scored 504 runs from 12 matches at an impressive average of 56, including a century and three fifties.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,600; BSE Sensex up marginally
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday. While Nifty50 was above 24,600, BSE Sensex was up marginally.

title: The BIG fallout between Elon Musk and Donald Trump's key cabinet members
content: Tensions have reached a boiling point between Elon Musk and Trump's cabinet, highlighted by a profanity-laced confrontation over IRS leadership. Musk's attempts to bypass protocol and implement sweeping spending cuts through his DOGE initiative have sparked outrage. Frustration is mounting among cabinet members who view Musk's methods as disruptive and ineffective.

title: Wake-up call before playoffs? Shubman Gill says ...
content: Shubman Gill lamented Gujarat Titans' costly extra runs conceded in their 33-run defeat to Lucknow Super Giants, despite Mitchell Marsh's explosive century. Gill highlighted the need for course correction before the playoffs, while Marsh celebrated his maiden IPL ton and emphasized the importance of finishing the season strong.

title: How DRG jawans celebrated after killing top Maoist leader Basavaraju; watch
content: Security forces in Chhattisgarh celebrated a major victory after neutralizing 27 Naxals, including top Maoist leader Basavaraju, in Narayanpur district. The successful operation in the Abujmarh forests resulted in the recovery of weapons and praise from national leaders. While one jawan was martyred, the operation marks a significant blow to the Naxal movement.

title: 45 killed in rain-related incidents in UP; more thunderstorms in store till Monday
content: Tragedy struck Uttar Pradesh as severe weather claimed lives. Forty-five people died due to heavy winds and thundershowers. The Chief Minister directed immediate relief efforts. Compensation will be provided to the families of the deceased. Agricultural damage assessments are underway. More thunderstorm activity is expected. The Met department issued warnings about temperature fluctuations. Residents are advised to stay informed.

title: MrBeast net worth hits $1 bn, YouTuber becomes youngest self-made billionaire
content: Jimmy Donaldson, widely recognized as MrBeast, has achieved billionaire status at 27, primarily through his YouTube content. Starting with simple videos, he gained fame for challenges, giveaways, and philanthropy. His business ventures, including Beast Burger and Feastables, alongside strategic content reinvestment, propelled him to become YouTube's most-subscribed creator and a leading philanthropist.

title: Rivaba reacts to Ravindra Jadeja’s record-breaking milestone
content: Rivaba Jadeja expressed her pride as Ravindra Jadeja became the longest-reigning No.1 Test all-rounder, a moment of honour for their family and Indian cricket fans. She acknowledged India's progress in sports and thanked the Indian team's players and coaches. As per the latest ICC Men’s Test Player Rankings, Jadeja holds the top spot with 400 points, comfortably ahead of Bangladesh’s Mehidy Hasan Miraz, who sits second with 327 points.

title: In her own (AI) voice: 5 things Melania Trump reveals in her memoir
content: Melania Trump uses artificial intelligence for her memoir. The audiobook features her AI-generated voice. The book covers her life, political views, and controversies. She talks about her marriage to Donald Trump and her stance on abortion. Melania also shares her experience of watching an assassination attempt on TV. She criticises the misuse of AI in creating harmful content.

title: IPL match today, RCB vs SRH: All you need to know
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, eyeing a top-two IPL finish for the first time since 2016, will face Sunrisers Hyderabad in Lucknow. RCB, currently second, aims to capitalize on Virat Kohli's form and contributions from Patidar and Shepherd. SRH, positioned eighth, seeks a strong end to their season, relying on their aggressive batting lineup.

title: Abhishek Bachchan's old tweet swooning over wife Aishwarya resurfaces after Cannes
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's stunning appearance at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival, particularly in a Gaurav Gupta creation, sparked renewed interest in her past Cannes moments. An old tweet from Abhishek Bachchan, expressing his admiration for her 2014 appearance, resurfaced and went viral, highlighting their enduring romance. Her choice to wear sindoor also garnered attention, effectively dispelling recent divorce rumors.

title: Month after meadow massacre, empty hotels, restaurants speak of Pahalgam’s desolation
content: Following the terror attack in Baisaran meadow, Pahalgam's tourism sector has suffered a significant blow, impacting local businesses and livelihoods. Restaurants, souvenir shops, and hotels are experiencing a drastic decline in customers, with many shops shuttered. Despite the challenges, locals remain hopeful that tourism will rebound with the upcoming Amarnath Yatra and autumnal festivities, banking on the area's enduring appeal.

title: IPL 2025: How Gujarat Titans can still finish in top two despite loss to LSG
content: Gujarat Titans faced a setback against Lucknow Super Giants, impacting their top-two aspirations. Despite the loss, they still lead the points table. Their upcoming match against Chennai Super Kings is crucial. A win would significantly boost their chances. However, results from Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings' matches will also play a key role in determining their final position.

title: How YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra became first catch in ISI agent Danish’s spy hunt
content: An expelled Pakistan High Commission staffer, identified as an ISI officer, attempted to recruit Indian nationals by targeting visa applicants and their relatives. He aimed to gather sensitive information and promote pro-Pakistan narratives online. This incident follows a pattern of Pakistani intelligence operatives using the high commission for espionage, leading to previous expulsions and staff reductions.

title: Luka Modric net worth: How much did the Ballon d'Or winner earn with Real Madrid?
content: Luka Modric, the celebrated Real Madrid midfielder, has surprised the football community by acquiring a part ownership stake in Swansea City, a Championship league team. At 39, Modric, with an estimated net worth of £56.8 million, continues to play for Real Madrid while venturing into club ownership.

title: Watch: Nicholas Pooran's explosive response to Siraj's sledging
content: Nicholas Pooran's explosive batting display, highlighted by a fiery response to Mohammed Siraj's sledging, propelled Lucknow Super Giants to a commanding victory over Gujarat Titans. Pooran's record-breaking fifty and Mitchell Marsh's maiden IPL century powered LSG to a formidable total, denting GT's hopes for a top-two finish despite their strong position in the league.

title: TOI Exclusive: 'Virat Kohli will be sorely missed on Test stage'
content: Brad Haddin emphasises Virat Kohli's significant impact on Test cricket, highlighting his competitive spirit and passion during high-stakes matches against top teams like Australia. Haddin believes Kohli's absence will be deeply felt in the Test format, considering it his most influential arena. He also praises Shreyas Iyer's leadership qualities and his strong rapport with coach Ricky Ponting.

title: Stock calls for today: What brokerages are recommending for May 23
content: Stock market recommendations: Indian equity markets faced a downward trend this week, influenced by global cues and profit-taking. Bajaj Broking Research suggests a consolidation phase for Nifty between 24,350 and 25,000. Bank Nifty is expected to consolidate between 53,500 and 56,000, with dips considered buying opportunities.

title: Joe Root's 13,000 milestone headlines England's record-breaking day
content: England dominated the opening day against Zimbabwe, marked by Joe Root becoming the fastest to 13,000 Test runs, surpassing Jacques Kallis. England's top order exhibited a ruthless 'Bazball' approach, with Zak Crawley, Ben Duckett, and Ollie Pope all scoring centuries. This batting masterclass propelled England to a staggering 498/3, their highest ever opening-day total at home.

title: 'We can play good cricket': Pant finds hope in LSG's fight despite playoff miss
content: Rishabh Pant expressed satisfaction after Lucknow Super Giants' 33-run victory over Gujarat Titans, highlighting the team's potential despite their IPL 2025 playoff exit. He praised the batting performances of Mitchell Marsh, Aiden Markram, and Nicholas Pooran, acknowledging the team's resilience amidst injury concerns. While noting fielding lapses, Pant remained optimistic about learning and improving.

title: Who was TKSS's Das Dada? All you need to know
content: The Kapil Sharma Show team mourns the loss of Krishna Das, fondly known as Das Dada, their associate photographer. Das Dada, who was an integral part of the show since its inception in 2016, passed away recently. Celebrities and the show's team expressed their condolences, remembering him for his cheerful presence and contributions to capturing memorable moments on set.

title: Japan’s ‘New Baba Vanga’: The manga artist whose predictions cause travel collapse
content: A prophecy by Japanese manga artist Ryo Tatsuki is causing travel concerns. Her prediction of a major disaster in July 2025 is impacting tourism. East Asian tourists are cancelling trips to Japan. Travel agencies report booking declines. Chinese authorities issued advisories. The Japan Meteorological Agency downplays the prophecy. Online discussions about disaster preparedness are increasing.

title: Mission: Impossible - The final reckoning Box Office Day 6: crosses Rs 50 crore mark
content: Tom Cruise's 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' has earned over Rs 50 crore in India within six days. Despite a slight mid-week dip, it's expected to perform well, boosted by positive reviews and minimal competition. Globally, projections estimate a record-breaking opening weekend of $200-$220 million.

title: Crossing the Rubicon: Why Op Sindoor is a turning point — and Pakistan has no playbook left
content: Operation Sindoor reshaped South Asia's strategic landscape. India retaliated against Pakistan following a terror attack. The operation involved air, cyber, naval, and informational domains. India demonstrated its strategic sovereignty. It challenged Pakistan's nuclear deterrence. India now controls the escalation narrative. The country established a precedent for pre-emptive action. India also showcased narrative warfare proficiency.

title: Days After India's Message, IMF Defends Bailout Package To Pakistan
content: Last week, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) slapped 11 new conditions on Pakistan for the release of the next tranche of its bailout program.

title: Should Have Given Himself Title Of 'King': Imran Khan Slams Pak Army Chief
content: Army chief Gen Asim Munir should have given himself the title of "king" instead of field marshal as Pakistan is currently governed by the jungle law, jailed former premier Imran Khan said on Thursday.

title: Supreme Court Stays Release Of Air Force Officer With Role In Op Sindoor
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed the Centre and the Indian Air Force not to release from service a woman officer, who was part of Operation Balakot and Operation Sindoor but was denied permanent commission.

title: Jailed Columbia Student Mahmoud Khalil Meets Newborn Son For First Time
content: Mahmoud Khalil, a Columbia University student and pro-Palestinian activist arrested by US immigration agents in March, met his month-old son for the first time on Thursday before an immigration hearing, his attorneys said.

title: How Donald Trump's Crackdown On Harvard Will Affect Indian Students
content: US President Donald Trump's administration has revoked Harvard University's authority to enrol international students under a federal government scheme called the federal Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP).

title: Japan Taxi Driver Suspected Of Drugging, Raping 50 Women: Report
content: Japanese police said Thursday they arrested a former taxi driver on suspicion of drugging and raping a female passenger, with media reports saying there could be dozens more victims.

title: Delhi University Objects To Rahul Gandhi's Visit, Calls It Breach Of Protocol
content: Delhi University on Thursday objected to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's unannounced visit to its North Campus, calling it a breach of institutional protocol and a disruption of student governance operations.

title: How Trump's Decision Will Affect Harvard's International Students
content: President Donald Trump's administration escalated its standoff with Harvard University on Thursday, revoking the school's ability to enroll international students.

title: What Harvard Said On Trump Halting Its Ability To Enroll Foreign Students
content: There were over 6,000 international students enrolled at Harvard during the 2024-2025 academic year, representing 27.3 per cent of the student body.

title: UP Man Arrested For Spying For Pak, Was Part Of "Anti-National" WhatsApp Groups
content: The Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS0) received intelligence that Tufail, son of Maqsood Alam, a resident of Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, was associated with a WhatsApp group created by Pakistan-backed anti-national organizations aimed at harming.

title: Srinagar Records Highest Temperature In May In Over 50 Years
content: Srinagar city recorded the highest maximum temperature in the month of May in nearly six decades on Thursday as the temperature settled at 34.4 degrees Celsius, the weather office said.

title: 2 Killed, 8 Injured After Small Plane Crashes Into California Neighborhood
content: At least two people were killed and eight others injured on Thursday when a small plane crashed in a San Diego neighborhood where military families lived, damaging houses and vehicles.

title: Bangladesh's Interim Government Chief Muhammad Yunus Planning To Resign: Report
content: The National Citizen Party chief Nhid Islam said Muhammad Yunus expressed his fear that he would not be able to work in the current situation of Bangladesh.

title: Melania Trump Releases Audiobook Of Memoir Narrated By AI
content: US First Lady Melania Trump warned recently of the danger of AI deepfakes. Now she is releasing an audiobook narrated by an artificial intelligence-generated version of her own voice.

title: Trump Administration Bars Harvard University From Enrolling Foreign Students
content: In April, Donald Trump had called Harvard a "joke" and said it should lose its government research contracts after the prestigious university refused demands that it accept outside political supervision.

title: Top Court Directs Centre To Curb Illegal Encroachments On Highways, Form Teams
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday directed the Centre to constitute surveillance teams for regular highway patrols to inspect and collect data regarding unauthorised encroachments.

title: US Court Allows Trump To Fire Independent Board Members -- But Not At Fed
content: The US Supreme Court on Thursday allowed President Donald Trump to fire leaders of two independent agencies, but signalled that such dismissals would not be permitted for the Federal Reserve.

title: "7,200 Tests Completed": ISRO Declares 2025 As Gaganyaan Year
content: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) chief V Narayanan highlighted the importance of 2025, which has been declared the "Gaganyaan" year.

title: 4.3 Magnitude Of Earthquake Hits Nepal
content: An earthquake of magnitude 4.3 hit Nepal in the early hours of Friday, as reported by the National Center of Seismology (NCS).

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make first move for €80m Real Madrid star Rodrygo
content: Arsenal have held the first exploratory discussions to sign Rodrygo from Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: J.J. McCarthy, fiancée Katya Kuropas announce pregnancy
content: Adam Schefter says the Vikings always intended for J.J. McCarthy to be their QB1 heading into this season. (0:53) J.J. McCarthy  and his fiancée are having a baby. Katya Kuropas, whom the new  Minnesota Vikings  quarterback proposed to in January 2024, made the announcement on a joint Instagram post on Wednesday night. The couple revealed they are expecting a boy and that he is due to arrive in September. A post shared by Katya (@katyakuropas) Kuropas' post included a video where the two showed off their baby's ultrasound photos. McCarthy was taken with the No. 10 pick in the 2024 NFL draft after a stellar career with the  Michigan Wolverines . He tore his meniscus in the preseason and missed the entire 2024 season due to injury.

title: 'Go and change the world': Commanders' Dan Quinn delivers speech at alma mater
content: he gave a knockout punch to the 100th graduating class at his alma mater . "Let it f---ing rip!" Quinn said, before walking away from the podium to applause . he has worked with a mental skills coach to channel negative thoughts into positive energy .

title: Centre to fast-track Indus irrigation and power projects
content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at the Times of India . he has been covering parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India’s position at global platform . before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, he had covered internal security and investigative agencies for over a decade .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: the college football playoff will move to a straight seeding model in 2025 . the 2025 season starts in less than 100 days . there are still plenty to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond .

title: Yaron Lischinsky And Sarah Milgrim: Israeli Embassy Staff Shot Dead In US
content: the two staffers were shot dead by a gunman outside a Washington Jewish museum . they had planned to make a formal proposal of marriage to Sarah Milgrim next week . the 30-year-old had worked as a researcher at the Israeli embassy in Washington since 2022 .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for every FBS team, plus an early look at CFP contenders
content: the 2025 college football season starts again in 93 days . teams have averaged more than 19 transfers this offseason, up more than 40% from last season . the returning production numbers are based on rosters I have updated as much as humanly possible .

title: How Jim Irsay prepared his daughters to succeed him as Colts owners
content: Jim Irsay grew up in privilege, with his father amassing a big enough fortune to acquire the Baltimore Colts in 1972 . but his involvement with the franchise did not originate in the boardroom . he often told stories about picking up players' jockstraps while cleaning the locker room .

title: 👊 Haliburton 'choke' latest in Pacers-Knicks beef
content: the 2025 Eastern Conference finals are a matchup straight out of the 1990s . new york and Indiana have faced off in the postseason eight times . the last time the Knicks were playing for a spot in the Finals was in 2000 .

title: Why do fans boo their team, and will it happen again to Alexander-Arnold?
content: Janusz Michallik reacts to fans booing Trent Alexander-Arnold . he was coming on as a substitute against arsenal two weeks ago . but some of the home crowd chose to make their feelings known .

title: 16 must-watch stars, 8 must-watch matchups: Top players in the 2025 college softball super regionals
content: the 2025 NCAA softball super regionals is set for the women's college world series in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma . no. 2-seed Oklahoma will host a no. 15-seed Alabama team that looks to spoil the Sooners' five-peat quest with its talented roster . here are the must-watch players on every remaining team .

title: Which teams are the most QB-needy for 2026? Here are 11 teams that are in the market
content: the bulk of the 2026 recruiting class will sort itself over the next three months . 43% of ESPN's top 300 prospects sealed their final commitments between June 1 and Aug. 31 . all four of the nation's five-star QBs and 14 of the 18 passers ranked inside 2026 ESPN 300 are committed .

title: NALCO records highest ever profit at ₹5325 crore
content: The Navaratna central public sector enterprise is ready with plan for the 5th stream expansion of the alumina refinery, the operationalization of the Potangi Bauxite Mines, and expansion of the existing smelter plant and captive power plant

title: Odisha CM Mohan Charan Majhi lays foundation of projects worth ₹1.15 lakh crore in Kalinga Nagar
content: Tata Steel’s 5 MTPA Integrated Steel Plant (ISP) expansion at an estimated investment of Rs 47,599 crore was inaugurated

title: May 13 disruption in TN, Kerala highlights pitfalls of telecom growth
content: Earlier this month, Airtel users lost access to phone calls for several hours across all of Tamil Nadu and Kerala, the largest such disruption in recent times.

title: Kerala HC issues directive to family courts on parents’ custody of children
content: Do not make police stations a place for exchanging children for custody between the separated mother and father

title: Standing ovation for Satyajit Ray’s restored film in Cannes spreads joy in Bengal
content: The film, based on a story by the celebrated Bengali writer Sunil Gangopadhyay, is about four Calcutta friends taking an unplanned break to the forests.

title: Multi-party delegation arrives in Moscow, to meet members of Russian Duma and Foreign Ministry
content: On May 24, they are scheduled to address a press conference and interact with the local media before leaving for Slovenia.

title: Kalaburagi cherishes the enduring legacy of Banda Nawaz
content: The final resting place of Hazrath Khwaja Banda Nawaz Gesu Daraaz in Kalaburagi has devotees cutting across religious boundaries visiting

title: Akshara Brahma: Where every word is a prayer for A.P.’s Savara tribals
content: In the valleys of the Eastern Ghats, a quiet social revolution is afoot. Hundreds of Savaras, a particularly vulnerable group of tribespeople renowned for their art and dance, are adopting a unique religious order that views their language as divine. In ‘Akshara Brahma’, the community sees a vehicle to ensure the continuity of its culture and uplift people, finds T Appala Naidu

title: Saraswati Pushkaralu in Kaleshwaram: when rivers meet and faith overflows
content: With the once-in-12-years Saraswati Pushkaralu under way, the town of Kaleshwaram has transformed into a sacred theatre of ritual and riverine power. At this rare confluence of three rivers — Godavari, Pranahita and the invisible Saraswati — pilgrims gather to seek spiritual liberation, guided by myths and the deep pull of something unseen yet powerfully felt, writes P. Sridhar

title: BJP W.B. State president Sukanta Majumdar’s wife named in two voter lists, complaint filed at election commission
content: This development comes as the ruling Trinamool Congress leaders have accused BJP of trying to include duplicate and fake voters in Bengal’s voter lists

title: India welcomes U.K.'s decision to hand over sovereignty of Chagos Islands to Mauritius
content: In its reaction, India said it has consistently supported Mauritius's "legitimate claim" over the Chagos Archipelago in keeping with its principled position on "decolonisation, respect for sovereignty, and the territorial integrity of nations".

title: Bengaluru under water yet again
content: Boats and tractors were pressed into service to rescue people as pre-monsoon showers battered the city and left many layouts and roads flooded. K.V. Aditya Bharadwaj and Shreyas H.S. examine the systemic problems that have pushed the city into such situations repeatedly

title: School timings changed in Kashmir amid heatwave conditions
content: According to an order issued by Directorate of School Education Kashmir, the new timing in schools within the municipal limits of Srinagar city will be from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m., while in the areas falling outside the municipal limits, the timing will be from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.

title: ‘Bengal actively transitioning to renewable energy, seeks private sector participation’
content: This comes amidst a nationwide push for a transition to clean energy sources, with a target of achieving 500 gigawatts (GW) of energy from non-fossil sources by 2030

title: Sanjay Raut alleges attempt to bribe State Legislature’s panel during Dhule visit, CM orders SIT probe
content: Mr. Raut called for a thorough probe into the matter to investigate the person under whose name room 102 was booked

title: Keshav lashes out at Jagan for his remarks on NDA govt.
content: They are aimed at stalling development of the State and Amaravati, and terrorise industrialists, says the Finance Minister

title: No deadline to apply for ration cards, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: Cards are being issued in 21 days of submission of application, subject to compliance with the eKYC norm, he says

title: Suvendu Adhikari targets WB Government over OBC reservation
content: In May 2024, the Calcutta High Court cancelled all Other Backward Classes (OBC) certificates issued in West Bengal since 2010

title: Awami League supporters stare at an uncertain future under the interim government
content: Individuals previously aligned with the Awami League are increasingly being subjected to mob attacks and legal persecution under the Yunus-led interim government; at least 119 people have been killed and 74 injured since the interim government assumed office in August, says Human Rights Support Society

title: Naidu insists on scientific crop planning that aligns with global and domestic market trends
content: Cultivation must be restricted to crops with strong market demand, he says, adding that short-term and long-term challenges need to be addressed through the Cabinet Sub-Committee

title: EAM Jaishankar interacts with members of German Parliament, chairs conference of Indian Ambassadors in Europe
content: In Berlin, EAM Jaishankar chaired the regional conference of Indian Ambassadors in Europe, where he discussed Operation Sindoor and India’s message of zero tolerance for terrorism.

title: Take holistic approach to clean Yamuna: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister directs Delhi government to strengthen the sewage system, fill DJB vacancies, and modernise drains

title: SC directs Karnataka Government to release TDR certificates in favour of royal family heirs
content: The case relates to the acquiring of Bangalore Palace Grounds for widening the Ballari and Jayamahal roads

title: Jagan calls liquor scam allegations a ‘sham’
content: Despite no evidence to prove that the scam occurred during the YSRCP’s tenure, retired civil servants and YSRCP leaders are being targeted, says the former Chief Minister

title: From now, pay to use toilet at 12 Namma Metro stations
content: BMRCL has handed over the management of restrooms located in the unpaid areas of these stations to Sulabh International, a non-profit known for managing public sanitation facilities.

title: Kochi metro seeks help of BPCL, agri-horticulture society for greening medians
content: District Agri-Horticulture Society’s expertise to be sought to plant apt variety of plants atop medians; KMRL in talks with BPCL on the oil major taking over the upkeep of the medians by planting saplings

title: Concern over shoddy condition of roads in Kochi
content: KMRL yet to resurface one side of heavily barricaded Civil Line Road; councillor urges KWA to promptly repair trenched portions and calls for effective use of pothole repair machine

title: Pedestrians upset over footpaths being encroached on Erukancheri High Road
content: They point out that a portion of the highway, which runs through the Vyasarpadi market, is narrow and has no footpath. This forces people to walk on the road. The road must be widened or an alternative route must be provided for vehicles so that they do not enter the market area, they say

title: Free serving of gravy with parotta is no longer guaranteed
content: Consumer panel decrees it is not enforceable under Consumer Protection Act. Petitioner had sought ₹1 lakh as compensation for mental agony and legal action after restaurant did not serve gravy when he ordered parotta and beef fry while dining out with a friend last year

title: Month after terror attack, Pahalgam tourist spots remain silent
content: According to the Pahalgam Hotels and Owners Association (PHOA), the occupancy rate at the more than 1,500 hotels in Pahalgam has dipped to a mere 10%.

title: Anna University ties up with U.S.-based firm for precision medicine research
content: The collaboration aims to establish a Centre of Excellence in Personalised and Precision Medicine Research in the Department of Pharmaceutical Technology, University College of Engineering, in Tiruchi

title: Tamil Nadu records 397 wetland bird species, 401 terrestrial bird species in synchronised survey
content: Surveys were conducted across 934 wetland sites, with all forest divisions instructed to cover approximately 20 places per district; 136 long-distance migratory species were observed, making up 34% of the total species recorded

title: Rise in Japanese encephalitis cases prompts T.N. to expand vaccination coverage
content: Study by CMC Vellore and DPH identifies infection in five districts; Chennai records highest number of cases

title: UAPA tribunal upholds Centre’s decision to declare Meghalaya’s Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council as ‘unlawful association’ for another five years
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs says the Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council used social media platforms, including Facebook (Meta) and WhatsApp, as tools for radicalisation, recruitment of unsuspecting youth into its fold

title: Suspension of government ads in J&K an assault on press freedom: Mehbooba
content: PDP president alleges selective allocation of advertisements; urges restoration of support to empanelled newspapers

title: Allahabad High Court refuses to quash FIR against Mohammed Zubair for his tweets on Yati Narsinghanand
content: The High Court, however, continued the interim protection from arrest granted to Zubair in December last year

title: Vellore Corpn. begins vaccination programme for community dogs
content: The aim of the drive is to reduce the risk of rabies and manage the growing stray dog population in the town, say Corporation officials

title: India reminds Turkiye, China of ‘mutual sensitivities’
content: MEA spokesperson says Turkiye expected to urge Pakistan to end support for cross-border terror; comments come after Turkiye delivered weapons to Pakistan and Beijing hosted Pakistan Foreign Minister

title: Multi-party teams are on political mission against terror, says India
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar takes the cause to Europe while Foreign Secretary Misri visits Japan; Shrikant Shinde begins UAE visit with meetings in Abu Dhabi

title: In HC, Centre defends revocation of Türkiye-based Celebi’s security clearance
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the court that during “unprecedented” times, providing a hearing or reasons before taking action “defeats the purpose,” especially in matters concerning national security

title: Roadmap for circular economy will be ready within six months: Pattabhiram
content: Establishment of recycling industries will generate employment and livelihood opportunities for youth, says Swachhandhra Corporation Chairman

title: Days after Amritsar hooch tragedy, 3 die consuming liquor in Ludhiana
content: Three labourers — Rinku (40), Debi (27) and Mangoo (32) — consumed liquor at a vacant plot along Noorwala Road on May 21, 2025 night

title: Kodumbalur, which was the seat of power of Irukkuvels, is an architectural marvel
content: Silapadikaram refers to it as a place situated on the way to Madurai, the capital of Pandyas, from Woraiyur, the Chola capital. It is referred to as Konattu kodi nagaram (the capital city of Konadu) in Periyapuranam. It boasts temples of great beauty. Inscriptions in the temples carry vital information on the history of the region

title: Nalanda University is in take-off mode, says Vice-Chancellor
content: Sachin Chaturvedi says university expects enrolment of about 900 students in the new academic session

title: A polar bear cub, gifted by Russia, couldn’t survive the Madras heat
content: To mark the centenary of the Madras Zoo, the Madras Corporation requested the Moscow Zoo for a polar bear as a gift. In October 1955, a polar bear cub arrived in Madras. But it died in the summer of 1959, though it was housed in a ‘polar weather enclosure’

title: Salvation Army’s dispensary that became a well-known hospital near Nagercoil
content: The international charitable organisation runs many hospitals worldwide. Its first hospital was established at Putheri. In 1893, Major William Stevens set up a dispensary at the modest bathroom on the veranda for Captain Henry John Andrews to treat the poor. Captain Andrews laid the foundation for Salvation Army Catherine Booth Hospital

title: Strike paralyses normal life in Manipur’s Imphal Valley
content: The 48-hour general strike was enforced to protest the masking of ‘Manipur’ displayed on a bus carrying a team of journalists to the Shirui Lily Festival in a Naga-dominated district

title: Sishu Gruhas, Bala Sadans reel under fund crunch as they await release of budget by govt.
content: Proposals for the first quarter budget have been sent and funds will be released shortly, says official

title: Thiruvananthapuram registers 71.73% pass in Plus Two higher secondary examinations
content: As many as 30,919 students appeared for the exams this year in the regular school going category. The number of students who secured A+ grade in all subjects was 2,371, against 3,458 last year

title: Incorrect to say India doesn’t have a National Security Strategy: CDS
content: Gen. Chauhan says no nation can secure itself without a strategy in place; the important constituents of a strategy will be Policy, Processes and Organisational Structures; “I believe India has all these functioning efficiently”

title: Indian team scales world’s third-highest peak
content: Sikkim organisation unhappy as Mt. Khangchendzonga is revered as the guardian deity of the indigenous communities
